topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1 Beta: Step 3 -Deploying the Lifecycle Manager in a Non-SA/Denver Deployment

body.p: The first phase of the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation involves creating a bootstrapping the lifecycle manager VM and installation services.
The installation uses Ansible playbooks, which are files that contain scripts that execute required installation processes.

section.title: Prepare the system for deployment
section.p: Use the following steps to prepare the server on which the lifecycle manager will be deployed (the lifecycle manager host):

ol.li: Log into the lifecycle manager host using the default credentials
Edit the /root/infra-ansible-playbooks/group_vars/all file for your environment. For information on each variable, refer to the comments in the file with each variable.

section.title: Deploy the Lifecycle Manager Virtual Machine
section.p: Use the following steps on the lifecycle manager host to deploy the lifecycle manager on that host using Ansible playbooks.

ol.li: On the lifecycle manager, change to infra-ansible-playbooks directory cd ~/infra-ansible-playbooks

Execute one of the following commands
Use the HCG Dashboard to deploy the cloud:
Use this option if you intend to deploy the Standard Region cloud using the HCG Dashboard. ansible-playbook -i hosts setup_hlm_for_UI.yml
Use the CLI to deploy the cloud
Use the following command if you intend to deploy the Standard Region cloud using the command line:ansible-playbook -i hosts setup_vcloud.yml
This command deploys and configures the lifecycle manager VM. Aftetr deployment, you can add the lifecycle manager host to OpenSAF cluster manually.
